p: P. vulgaris was also reported to possess anti-apoptotic effects. It increased the expression of caspase-3 and Bax, and decreased the expression of Bcl-2 [ 167]. As anti-inflammatory agent, P. vulgaris acted through the inhibition of p38 MAPK/ ERK signaling pathway and regulated TNF-Î±-induced expression of adhesion molecules [ 168]. Considering all these findings, P. vulgaris could be a promising therapeutic alternative for the management of endometriosis.
